result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack G Trebtoske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must obtain high school diploma.

The defendant must attend school every day that school is in session and attend all classes, upon completion of school - must become employed or pursuit college or join the armed services.

The defendant may not posses/consume any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.
The defendant must participate and complete an anger management program and follow thru with all recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed for school.

Community service authorized under 973.03(3).

Credit for 6 days only if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
All other conditions the same as count 1 with no additional jail or community service.
Concurrent with: Count 1

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jack G Trebtoske

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 60 days of jail added without huber privileges
Request/Agreement for Modification to conditions of Probation - 45 days of jail added as a condition of probation, without huber. Approved.

Called at 3:29 PM. Also called 14CF101. Jack Trebtoske appears in person and in custody with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono.  State - believe the PH will be waived to due a potential plea/offer and no jail in this case. Trebtoske and Roley agree that the offer weighed into the decision to waive the PH today. Court goes thru waiver of PH collaquey, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Roley has Information that mirrors complaint, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, set for FPT on 10/15/14 at 1:30 PM. Roley makes argument for bond reduction - asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State - no objections. Court - bond - modifies to $2500.00 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol and no contact with victim. State - have complied with victim notification requirements - on 14CF85 - the defendant would plead g/nc to counts #1 and #4, DRI #2 and #3, place on probation for 2 years per count, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: #1 - 45 days of conditional jail, costs, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, pursuit and acquire HS diploma, absolute sobriety, 100 hours of community service (change from 240 hours on original offer), count #2 - same conditions with no additional jail or community service. Roley and Trebtoske agree. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3. Trebtoske pleads NC to counts #1 and #4 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, find the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitional rights by entering his plea, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Roley - follow joint recommendation. Tretboske makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: 45 days in FC jail - huber allowed for school - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 6 days only if revoked, costs (including DNA surcharge) - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, participate and complete an anger management program and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain HS diploma, must attend school every day that school is in session and attend all classes, upon completion of school - become employed or pursuit college or join the armed services, 100 hours of community service; count #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to count #1, with same conditions except no additional jail or community service, costs (including DNA surcharge) - paid thru probation, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on September 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 2:14 PM. Also called 14CF101. Jack Trebtoske appears in person and in custody and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. Roley would like time to talk to the defendant regarding the plea offer. Recess to do so. Recalled at 2:29 PM with same appearances. Roley would like to address both cases together, has received the new complaint and has gone over it with the defendant, waives formal reading, requests PH within time limits. Court sets for PH on 9/3/14 at 3:00 PM. Roley asks that this matter be set over to 9/3/14 at same time for a possible global resolution. State asks about 14CM97. Court keeps that matter on the 9/12/14 JT date that it is currently set for. Court sets 14CF85 for another FPT on 9/3/14 at 3:00 PM and continues bond on that matter. Roley asks for bond reduction on new case for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to bond modification for stated reasons - if resides at home. Roley responds - asks that the court allow the mother to make a statement. Mom makes statement. Discussion on how school will be accomplished for the defendant has he is currently a senior at Laona High School. Roley makes another argument for signature bond. Court - bond - continues bond at this point on 14CF101.
Final pre-trial on August 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Called at 3:03 PM. Jack Trebtoske appears in person and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Jodi Bendar Clemens. Roley provides court with waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Roley has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 8/27/14 at 1:30 PM.
and certificate of appearance - Deputy WH
Defendant called with address 6893 Old Hwy 8 Rd, Laona, WI 54541
Preliminary hearing on July 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. Must notify the court within 24 hours of his address or cash bond will be reinstated.

Called at 9:58 AM. Jack Trebtoske appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Thomas Roley appears in person. State appear by JBC. Roley has complaint, has not gone over it with the defendant. Trebtoske does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Trebtoske understands charges and penalties. Roely waives further reading, requests PH and would like it within time limits. Court continues bond, set for PH on 7/23/14 at 3:00 PM. Trebtoske wants to make statement. Court advises to talk to attorney first. Trebtoske asking for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections to signature bond as long as a conditions state that he cannot write any sort of checks. Court makes statement - bond - reduces bond to $1000 signature with no consumption of alcohol, notify court within 24 hours of address. Roley now waiving the time limits for PH, court keeps as is.
